title: @Riot:  It should be pretty clear now that the community is enraged by your decisions involving Lore
body:
[Edit 9/4/14] Holy fuck, this just took on new levels of outrage.  The Institute of War is no longer canon.  [/Edit]

[RITO killed Ezreal's lore!!!!](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823079)
[@Riot THIS is what you call lore now??](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823023)
[Riot stop right now. Do NOT change Skarner's lore.](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823097)
[I am OUTRAGED at this excuse for "lore" being made](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823051)
[Welp, Shurima is the new Frejlord](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4822995)
["Lore does not make money, lore is not e-sports."](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4822987)
[Let's talk about the lore Riot!](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823322)
["But MOBAs can't have lore"](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823291)
[I have new info on Void Lore!!!](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823362)
[New Lore for Every Champion Confirmed!](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823388)
[Wow Riot changed Ahri's lore too?](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823440)

Even better, this one has a poll in it, though at the time of my writing this it has low participation:

[Poll: New Lore (Shurima Patch)](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823121)

[Edit 9/2/14] A days later, I've just found this thread.  The responses are quite relevant.

[So the hype train on Azir and the Shurima event.](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4835317) [/Edit]

This should have already been apparent from the backlash over the Great Freljordian Retconning.  But for some reason, we are doing this all over again.  You are brutally savaging the intricately detailed backstories of Champions, and replacing them with 1 or 2 paragraphs of super general facts.  Worst of all, you aren't giving any explanation as to why you are doing any of this.
---
{{champion:75}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:15}} 
With the creation of Azir, it does make sense for Nasus and Renekton to no longer be from another world.  The more reasonable among us can at least understand that.  And you obviously have a lot of story there that you want to tell, what with Azir having a number of VO lines confirmed through PBE for Sivir.  But if you're not going to ever share the story behind all of this, there really is no point in putting that story together in the first place, and ripping the beating hearts out of our chests and grinding them into dust before our eyes.  Renekton used to be a deep character.  His own love for battle was tainted by the continuous exposure to evil.  Now he literally is just a rage-beast hellbent on killing his brother, with no actual context as to what caused it, or why it's Nasus's fault.

Speaking of Sivir.....  Since she got her VU, there's been this unspoken understanding that she is from some kind of desert nomadic people, whom she left to pursue her career/interests as a mercenary, which made her incredibly rich.  While you are, in part, solidifying that through Azir's VO lines for her...  there's still an enormous amount of story there that is missing, to bridge the gap between her VU Lore, her previously existing Lore, and how that relates to Azir.  As it stands, she's kind of ending up in the same nowhere-space that Sejuani is -- "Rawr, I'm an angry barbarian and I like to raid and pillage people and stuff, and I'm going to rally the people of the Freljord behind my war banner or crush them under Bristle's hooves!!!  Oh by the way Olaf and Volibear are here too."  We know there's a lot more going on somewhere behind all that, but *you aren't telling us what it is!*  Similarly, if we pretend Sivir's old Lore doesn't exist for a moment, she's just this chill bandit chick who went exploring with Cassi this one time and something happened *TO BE CONTINUED (not really).*

**It doesn't matter if whatever you have going on behind closed doors is the best story anyone has ever thought of in the history of storytelling IF NO ONE EVER GETS TO SEE IT**
---
{{champion:72}} 
I don't even know where to begin on this one.  I literally cannot wrap my brain around the reasoning for doing this.  Skarner's backstory was the most unique among all the Champion Lore for one specific reason.  He was the only champion who's presence was rooted completely in a plot element.  He was the greatest protector of his people, awakened by the use of the portable Nexus to freeze the warring Demacian and Noxian delegations in time.  He worked to create the Crystal Scar, the battlefield upon which Dominion takes place, in such a way as to further protect his people, rather than continue to awaken them.  He was alone, but his loneliness kept his people safe from the harm they could suffer from a world not ready for them.

Now he's just a giant sentient scorpion from a desert who maybe is guarding someplace deep beneath Shurima.  I'm sorry, *what?*  Not just the fact that you destroyed the most unique thing you had.  Not just that you totally destroyed the interesting backstory of a champion.  Not just that you destroyed all ties between him and the Dominion game mode.  But you did ALL OF THIS, and replaced it with, quite literally, nothing.  I can't fathom who thought this was a good idea, and I refuse to even attempt to contemplate what the motivation was.  There can be no end result that justifies this kind of mistreatment of a truly beautiful character.
---
{{champion:32}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:81}} 
The long, sad tale of Amumu.  Originally he was just a boy with no memory and an unfillable void of sadness.  Then he became a Yordle who woke up in a pyramid with no memory, but the unshakable feeling that something really bad happened to him once.  Now he's just an animated cadaver.  Granted, it seems like you've never really known what you've wanted to do with Amumu, giving his alternating species over the years.  But I fail to see what the point of even retconning him was if you're not going to actually give his story some expansion.  In fact, you did just the opposite.  You took the shortest, least defining Lore of any champion in the game, and made it *smaller.*  I don't know if you really want to be congratulated on that impressive feat,  but you've certainly earned it.

And you did much the same thing with Rammus.  Before, his Lore indicated some really cool things about the Plague Jungles far to the south, and the mysterious wild magics that happen there.  Now he's just an armadillo that somehow became sentient, no idea how that happened, and he's got this cool armor and he wanders around looking for something.  These are your oldest characters.  These should be the ones with the longest, and most compelling backgrounds.  You've had years to think and elaborate on them.  Instead, you're just sucking the life out of them.  And we still don't know why.

And last but not least, there's Ezreal.  I hope you're going to throw out his existing VO lines and write him some brand new ones, because his existing set is anything but "embarrassed".  He's supposed to be a smart mouth who doesn't care what anyone else thinks or says.  All of his existing VO lines support this, demonstrating a boisterous attitude and a cocky disposition.  And now he's magically embarrassed.  Bigger question though:  why?  Why make this change?  Furthermore, why throw out a far more descriptive Lore, going into details about his origins, for no other gain beyond something that is completely at odds with all the other content related to the character?
---
You may have noticed a certain little 3 letter word that keeps coming up every time we talk about your changes to Lore.

Why?

Why are you wiping away all the beautiful details that made champions interesting, that gave players reasons to like them beyond what their 4 buttons do?
Why are you going to such great lengths to forge half links between characters, if you're not going to actually connect them?
Why are you demolishing the most unique aspects of your game?

Why?

Here's the part that's really telling about all of this.  You'd think, from the way I've written this post, that I main some of these champions, and play the others fairly heavily.  But that's the thing.  * **I DON'T MAIN OR PLAY ANY OF THEM** *  I mean, I'm decent at Ezreal and Sivir, and I manage to do ok with Nasus and Renekton in ARAMs.  But no, I do not have any real gameplay attachments to any of them.  I care about them because I find their Lore to be fascinating.  Reading the backstory of each new Champion, and figuring how they relate to the other existing champions, is awesome.  And somehow I doubt I'm alone in this view.

Recently, you have been going out of your way to starve a portion of the community.  And the thing that keeps echoing in my head, over and over again, is that same 3 letter word.

---
---
---

Why?

replies.body:
What bothers me even more is that Riot keeps screwing the lore over and over and over again, yet they never, ever, ever address the concerns of people who have them.

I mean, last time a Rioter pronounced himself regarding lore, he A: Wasn't part of the team, and B: Gave us no real information outside of "we're totally working on it!"

Riot, if there is a semblance of care in the body of any of your employees, please. I'm begging of you.

Be honest with us.

EXPLAIN, in detail, what the situation is.

All this lack of communication, all of this changes that nobody asked or wanted, this is fostering mistrust in your company. It may be small, it may be from a small portion of the player base, but you should address it regardless.

If you don't want to write lore anymore, and think it's a waste of time and resources, just say it already. A painful truth is a lot better than a lingering lie.

Don't forget, (though ironically I forget just which Rioter said it), but there was the one post recently where one of the Rioters claimed to be "surprised" people actually cared about the game's lore. Speaking as one of the writers, no less. Where on earth have they been?! You have got to try to be this out of touch with your community.

That was me. I went back and edited my comment because it blew up on Reddit and stuff.

I meant that I'm (pleasantly) surprised to see passion about it because there's so much obvious care about eSports, design, art, etc. It's super cool to see people come in and demand more because I don't get to experience it with such intensity.
"demand for more" does not mean "rewrite of lore"

Compared to the total active player base, those who actually care about Lore are a tiny minority. Very tiny. And since Riot has no way to directly profit from Lore, they simply can't be bothered to care.

Saying that, Lore is actually what keeps me playing games - if a game has deep and interesting Lore, I'm encouraged to keep playing. A couple years ago, I went through the trouble of digesting every lore-related league post, in-game tool-tip / info box, voice lines, and any other source of lore information. Why? I centralized it all into a single spreadsheet document so people could see all the lore this game had. It was a lot. And it was interesting.

Remember the Journal of Justice? That was my favorite part of this game. Seriously. I'd much rather read one of those newsletters than deal with the toxic players in solo queue. It was such a fun thing to read and learn more about the characters you're playing. It was eventually scrapped, unfortunately.

Sadly, those who care about game Lore are a slim minority.

I think he meant it in a "I thought people didn't care about the work we were doing" instead of a dismissive "You still on about that?"

Either way, it's about time they buckled down and told us what their master plan is. There's a big difference between trying to keep something cool a surprise and making everybody flip their lid because you left them hanging for two years.

By the time they actually unveil what their big plan is, the response is going to be less "Wow this is so cool, thanks Riot!" and more like "Jesus CHRIST finally you got off your lazy asses, what took you so long, you lazy bastards?"

And there is also something to be said about building excessive hype, Duke Nukem Forever, anybody?

> There's a big difference between trying to keep something cool a surprise and making everybody flip their lid because you left them hanging for two years.

Heh.  Two years.  It's been longer actually, almost three years since the Journal of Justice was stopped.

> By the time they actually unveil what their big plan is, the response is going to be less "Wow this is so cool, thanks Riot!" and more like "Jesus CHRIST finally you got off your lazy asses, what took you so long, you lazy bastards?"

This is absolutely true, and has continued to be true.

> there is also something to be said about building excessive hype

You mean like the hype leading into the announcement that Dominion would be coming in 6 months or all of the hype around Magma Chamber?
---
I don't mean to sound bitter, but if it takes three years and your master plan *still* hasn't happened, you need to communicate why that is.

Hell, even if they didn't think there was a large portion of the community interested they could still crank out some stuff. In my spare time in the past two years I could've (and have, for unrelated things) managed plenty of character stories and lore events, around having a job and being a student. They might not all be solid gold, but they would certainly define the characters. Furthermore, there are plenty of ways to incorporate old lore into new storylines without destroying the old stuff.

For instance, if they want Skarner to be a sort of enemy/monster of Shurima, why not make the Brackern and some Shurimans have some conflict? They only ever say Shurima was ancient, not how ancient. So Azir could know of some age old conflict and wish to eradicate an old Shuriman enemy. Bam, storyline.

Nasus and Renekton are still basically gods in the new lore, so why not just leave them as the basically gods of the old lore. It's not like being from a different planet/plane of existence ever mattered to fantasy interactions, or even mythological ones. I point you to all of Greek/Roman/Norse mythology, all the interactive planar spells in dungeons and dragons, the interactive influence of the Outlands on Azeroth. Precedent stands, and is strong.

Point is, if there can be a basis thought of in all of two seconds for a decent storyline incorporating the characters people already know, why destroy it just because you think nobody cares? It's not like we're looking for the next great piece of high fantasy to follow on the footsteps of things like the Wheel of Time or Game of Thrones, just a decent enough story to latch onto a character.

> I don't even know where to begin on this one. I literally cannot wrap my brain around the reasoning for doing this. Skarner's backstory was the most unique among all the Champion Lore for one specific reason. He was the only champion who's presence was rooted completely in a plot element. He was the greatest protector of his people, awakened by the use of the portable Nexus to freeze the warring Demacian and Noxian delegations in time.

Yeah, this Skarner retcon reminds me a lot of Trundle's.  Go from an incredibly interesting and compelling background to becoming a generic bad guy.
Everyone is reacting over nothing, lore is cool.  But, since when did it matter to the core of the game?

I'm getting tired of people like you saying "Oh, lore doesn't  matter, why do you care?"

Thing is, WE care, we like lore, it builds context, it adds passion to otherwise simple games, it builds a bond between player and character, it adds flavor to the game. Just because YOU don't see it doesn't mean that we all shouldn't.

I mean, people go on and on and on about LCS, which I couldn't give less of a crap about, but you don't see me saying "why are you so entranced by a bunch of jobbers clicking around while dramatic music plays in the background?" to people who like watching it. Why should people who like lore keep their mouths shut?

I never said it wasn't cool, my favorite lore is everything to do wit the Freljord.

However, as for this quote.  "why are you so entranced by a bunch of jobbers clicking around while dramatic music plays in the background?"

I am one of those jobbers clicking around while dramatic music plays in the background, no where near an LCS level though.

My point wasn't that you were or weren't interested in professional gaming, my point was that just because lore isn't a big deal to you doesn't mean it also shouldn't be a big deal to anybody.

I don't care about LCS, at all, every time I see a thread about LCS, I just ignore it. I don't go into it saying "Why are you giving so much attention to his tourney bullcrap? This doesn't affect you in any significative way, there's no point in caring".

YO

Sorry it took me so long to get to this thread. I'll go through and respond to individual comments in addition to writing this thing.

If you haven't already checked out our Dev Blog, it covers some concerns people are bringing up here: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/creative-spotlight/dev-blog-exploring-runeterra

*Please* give your thoughts on it - Tommy Gnox & co are responding in the discussion thread. Like, actually sitting in a room and responding to those comments.

**ANYWAYS, REFOCUSING**

We're in this uncomfortable position where there are obviously more story pieces to come surrounding Shurima. That's no secret. But I can't tell you what the story of Azir, Xerath, Sivir, etc is because that'd blow the whole point of doing an event like this. What I can tell you is that the shortened bios you're seeing on the PBE are bios that are meant for the client. They will live on the website as well once they go live, but longer story pieces will accompany them in time. The idea is to change our bio format so you get a *quick* snapshot of who/what a champion is in the client - like, when you're gearing up to play a game - and entice more people to get to know champions. A very small portion of our players actually want to sit and read a novel (or 500ish words, but who's counting?) about a champion, so we're trying to appeal to as many players as possible while they're *in* the client. Meanwhile, you'll still be able to delve into a bigger story if you choose to seek it out for x champion. Azir will be one of these - I wouldn't want to give you new a champion with only a two-sentence explanation. I know we've disappointed you guys, but we aren't THAT out of touch.

Be patient. It pains me to say that. But it's COMING. IT'S COMING. STORY THINGS ARE COMING I SHIT YOU NOT. SOON (FURREAL)!!1!

However, I *know* you don't want to hear that. You guys keep saying you want the JoJ back, but we've been pushed to do better (as in, something more engaging/appealing - I think the JoJ was cool af) and *do* more. So far that's come with promos, shorts, champion interactions, bigger VO sets, and a new bio format. Unfortunately, this has also taken us a lot longer than anticipated for a ton of reasons that I won't bore you with. It doesn't matter to you, I get it. You just want it. It will come. But FUCK that feels bad to say.

Please read the Dev Blog - it's much more concise than I am, and Tommy Gnox & co are more eloquent than me. I. Whatever. I'm just some writer that likes to have "real talk" and my frustration probably comes out more than it should.

You guys are rad. Thanks for caring about this shit.

> *Please* give your thoughts on it - Tommy Gnox & co are responding in the discussion thread. Like, actually sitting in a room and responding to those comments.

Sure, I believe it, but why should we bother? You spent years and years quietly making these decisions, regardless of what we say, and at this point it's done. Retcons are happening, and won't be changed. Your choice to get rid of nearly half of all the lore League has ever had is finalized, and won't be changed. Responding to comments is nice, and we wish you'd been talking to us before now... I mean actually talking, rather than endless promises of "SOON!".

> What I can tell you is that the shortened bios you're seeing on the PBE are bios that are meant for the client.

This actually sounds pretty good and reasonable, honestly. I'm looking forward to rea-

>They will live on the website as well once they go live, but longer story pieces will accompany them in time.

In, uh... in time, huh? O-okay. Sure. Nono, it's fine, we'll wait. It's not like we've already been sitting around for *literally years* waiting for lore to happen. (Actual lore, not retcons and "soon" promises and noncanon videos.)

> Be patient. 

Pfffffft. PFFFFFT.

> So far that's come with promos, shorts, champion interactions, bigger VO sets, and a new bio format.

Non-canon, non-canon, frankly tiny but a nice start, good start, unnecessary and arguably less interesting.

>Unfortunately, this has also taken us a lot longer than anticipated for a ton of reasons that I won't bore you with. It doesn't matter to you, I get it. You just want it.


It *does* matter to us, but you guys in the lore department are so tight-lipped that there's no point in asking you about... well, anything. I don't know why people are even bothering to reach out right *now*. I don't know what I expect to accomplish with this post. Again, your decisions are finalized, feedback doesn't seem to actually matter much, and most of the points we've been making (again, for years) seem to just be ignored. Like, actually ignored. How many times have we said "a music video isn't lore"? How many times has the lore department pretended otherwise without providing any reasoning or justification behind that? Hell, taking longer to do awesome stuff is *GREAT*, but don't spend a few years silently removing more and more of what we love then saunter back in expecting us to trust you.

> You guys are rad. Thanks for caring about this shit.

Quite welcome! Someone has to.

I already responded to that devblog, so I'm just gonna respond to you here.

Do you know how long it's been since the JoJ and league judgements went away? I get it, things take time, but they don't take THAT long of a time. It's taken YEARS to get to this point. I've BEEN patient. So sorry if I'm not particularly excited by someone claiming that things are ACTUALLY HAPPENING THIS TIME GUYS! They said that about the freljord event, too, and that was a whole lot of nothing but retcons.

Speaking of which, I wasn't too attached to what the current lore is anyway, but seriously, Riot's predilection for retcons is worrying. You see the same things in comic books; executives thinking that current books are too hard to get in to, so they reboot everything. All that does is A) annoy the current fanbase, who have to figure out which stories are canon or not, what happened to their favorite characters, etc., and B) not bring in new readers, because if they actually liked comic books, they would have been reading the old ones. I get that you have to bring in new readers, but will completely rebooting everything do so?

Me and Riot seem to disagree on what 'lore' is. That 'New Dawn' video was not lore. It was cool, but it told us nothing but 'these are characters in the game! They fight!' Some of them showed their personality (Draven,) but others simply were there to do things (Jax). The champion interactions in league barely exist. Lucian having one line when he taunts near Thresh simply doesn't cut it in comparison to Dawngate or even DotA2. Backstories and VOs aren't lore. They're character establishment. They tell us 'Draven is self absorbed and cocky' or 'Amumu is sad' but they don't tell us about the world, or what's going to happen to Amumu now. The JoJ actually propelled things forwards. Most of the time, current league stories are about the past. That needs to happen, sure, but I'd rather have a post about Ezreal's and Lux's burgeoning relationship than about 'Gnar and Rengar fight'

Hell, there's so many problems I have with the lore itself I could keep myself going for a while. But first I want to be sure that Riot actually cares. Lore is the major thing I don't trust Riot on, so excuse me for being skeptical.

Riot spent 2 years building a specific kind of lore.

That lore is all now non-canon. I invested time in that and it now means literally nothing. At this point, wouldn't it make sense to call the "Ionian boots of lucidity" to just "boots of lucidity" because everything that happened before Freljord doesn't even exist anymore?

Riot has been claiming for 2 years now that they had a "better way to do lore" and all I am seeing is the destruction of the lore I knew to have it replaced with similar seeming ghosts of champions that I had come to love and hate because of things they didn't even do anymore.

So this raises a question then.

If the League is nolonger canon. What about character death?

In A New Dawn, we saw Graves, Nautilus, Zyra, Jax, Katarina, Darius and most of all DRAVEN get killed. Presumably, for good.

These are no small characters in LoL. I mean, Katarina has always been one of the faces of League, and with her and the Blood Brothers dead, Noxus's champion pool is suddenly missing its most well loved characters. If they're really dead, they can never appear again in future lore movies.

And of course, there's the issue of "if this is their end, their story went unresolved for no reason". We see Graves never gets his revenge because he took place in a fight he had really no business being in to begin with.

And the characters pretty much treat it like it's a League match too. The characters die left and right and their friends and family look at them and go "oh not again"


Or on the flipside, if these character deaths aren't canon, does that mean there truly isn't a canon? That lore videos can happen but the story of Runeterra actually wasn't advanced? Because as Runeterra lore goes, the big cinematic movies are basically the biggest things.

Poll-maker here (http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4823121). At the moment we've got 58/96 votes for "I HATE the new lore!". That's 60%. Riot, this isn't a joke, we really need to talk about this, and it needs to stop.

An extremely biased sample (people who visit General Discussion or would post in this thread) with poorly constructed poll options that likely isn't representative of the entire playerbase, many of which simply aren't involved on the boards or the forums [and that's literally just the english-speaking community]. Trying to use it as proof (read: giving this post/poll visibility) reduces the credibility of the thread--it does not improve it.

I dislike some of the retcons (mostly Skarner's). I also don't think this thread is helping *anybody* get what they want.

At this point, all that I want is a response from Riot. An actual response. Not an excuse, sidetrack, promises, vague hints, silly jokes, or discussions of the last episode of Saturday Night Live, but an actual explanation of what they're doing, why they're doing it, and what they're aiming towards at the end game.

Because quite frankly, I'm tired of how utterly vague Riot is with lore. When they say that they're reworking a champion, they go in detail as to why they're doing it and how they're doing it, when we ask about lore, which really shouldn't be as bad because not many people care about lore, they go "NUUUUU IS NOT FINISHED YET". Just open up already. I'm not asking for a complete breakdown, but at least some proof that all this retcon horsecrap that they've been pulling is aimed towards a greater goal rather than being "HEY! THERE'S A NEW EVENT COMING UP! LET'S PROMOTE A FEW CHAMPIONS!"

We're basically reworking it all. No Summoners, no Institute of War. That was a convenient excuse plot when LoL was first created, but we want to give champions more life/energy/agency/blah blah blah and remove them from the confines of the League. I certainly don't want to think Joe Schmoe Summoner can call upon Cho'Gath, shrink him down to human size, and have him fight Heimerdinger or something (although that'd be a cool battle to see). I want Cho'Gath to be at his fullest height and size and see people get rekt. 

Part of the struggle, for me at least, is that it's a monumental task to do a FULL re-envisioning for the ENTIRE cast and beyond, and we'd always be battling with time. I don't think piecemeal the ideal way to do it, but we now feel compelled/pressured to give you a start and follow-up. The entire time we wanted to do story "part 2's" and stuff we knew we were going to re-explore League's world, so a lot of those efforts were put on hold until we said something about our lore reboot.

Then why are they fighting in a 5v5 arena where they conveniently come back to life when they die and have no qualms about fighting side-by-side  with their mortal enemy who killed their mother/father/brother/roommate/whatever? The old lore was AMAZING? Was it convenient? Sure! Was it bad? NO! I loved it, lots of other people loved it, and now it's dead.

Also, new summoner's rift name?

It's still called Summoner's Rift. It's a name I think will never go away for League, so we're not going to make you call it something else.

What do you mean, why? It's a game, and we want to keep it that. It's okay for the game to stay the same and champions' backstories to change.

Okay, so, would I be wrong to say that the game should play akin to something like Super Smash Brothers? Each character has their own story (albeit, in League that story is connected to the world and to other characters) but the combative gameplay has no real story implications. So, there's a 5v5 arena because that's cool game play, and not for any particular narrative reasons.
Correct.

The thing about Smash Bros. (and why it works), is that even though we have a large cast of characters that would never meet otherwise duking it out on floating platforms, each and every one of these characters has a game of their own. Crossovers like Tatsunoko vs. Capcom can exist because the characters have games to *cross over from*. 

You can't really abandon League narrative-wise and hand-wave it as a crossover game, because League of Legends *is* where all of these characters have come from. You're divorcing the game from the story, tearing the IP into bits and chunks. While it may be easier and more convenient for those writing the lore, it's damaging to the IP as a holistic product and cleanly illustrates many of the problems that have developed over the years. When you sever connections, things start falling apart. 

I don't think I'll invest too much time trying to change anyone's mind, though. Lore, while something I'm passionate about, isn't my forte. I'm not the best equipped to really explain what I mean and why I believe it's valid, but I'll still hold onto some hope that something is learned from all of this and that everything can be brought together again.
Just an (insane) idea that i had for all this: League could be kind of "afterlife" that reflects on what has happened long ago on the Runeterra.

Then why should I care about it if it's all in the past? Edit: Okay, here's my perspective. I'll address each of the things that the lore team has been working on, and hopefully clarify this frustration.

1. Skins are not lore. That's something that has been true from the first skin releases. They can be cool, they can have side-stories, but in the end they are non-canon. Also, the stories around them tend to be fairly shallow anyway.
2. Retcons do not count until they provide an actual net gain. For instance, Trundle's remake did not actually add to the world and the stories in it in a meaningful way, so his Freljord retcon (in terms of story) was net neutral or worse. Many people were disappointed by the change, his new connections remain unexplored, and his previous story was arguably more complex.
3. Champion releases have lately been very lore-shallow. The champions themselves might have cool personalities and be interesting characters, but characters are just one tool to be used in the crafting of stories. They are not, in themselves, stories. This is also why things like the Jinx music video do not count as lore; there is no actual canonical story being told.
4. VO's have begun to include actual building of lore. This is the sort of world building which really counts, for me, and I'll be glad to see more. The expansion of VO's has been a bright spot in all of this.
5. Worldbuilding/R&D will be meaningful when we see the things built on that foundation. Because I can't see much of anything yet, I won't comment on what the results of that have been or might be. Really, this is just another "why must we wait yet longer" problem.
